Mid Pacific
Air
SERVICE DOOR EMERGENCY OPERATIONS
Press release catch down,
turn handle in direction of
arrow to open position.
Push door outwards,
swing around to against
fuselage allowing slide
to fall to ground.
Pull handle to inflate
evacuation slides.
Jump and sit
in slide.
LEFT EMERGENCY DOOR EXIT
Door Handle
1. Remove cover.
2. Push catch to right, pull
handle inward to stop position,
and push top of door out.
3. Let door fall.
4. Pull handle to inflate
evacuation slide.
5. Jump and sit in slide.
BRACE
POSITIONS
In an emergency
situation your
Flight Attendant
may request you to
assume one of
the Bracing
Positions shown.
INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE OF SEAT BELTS
LIFT TO UNFASTEN
Hold buckle and pull top strap for a tight fit. Please keep your seat
belt fastened at all times while in your seat.
PORTABLE ELECTRONIC DEVICES
Federal Aviation Agency (FAA) regulation prohibits the operation in flight of certain
portable electronic devices since they can interfere with the aircraft's navigation
system. Please check with the Flight Attendant before operating your radio, dictating
machine, recorder, or electronic game.

YS-11
Air

EXITS

1. To open window remove cover.
(ON ILLUSTRATION)

handle inward to stop position,
and push top of window out.

fall.
LIFE JACKETS
1. Place life jacket over
head through
circular opening.
2. Secure straps around
body by inserting hooks
3.

tabs on each side
of lower vest.
through rings and tightening.

signal, pull center

do not remove this card from aircraft.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by Mid Pacific Air for the Nihon Aeroplane YS-11; off-white double-sided laminated card with illustrations and text demonstrating safety instructions and emergency procedures.
